Column Comment.0: LICENSEE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the businessassociate to whom this license has been granted.
Column Comment.1: LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the approval granted to conduct activitiesor operations.
Column Comment.2: LICENSE CONDITION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the condition that is appliedto this license.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: CONDITION CODE: A codified value associated with a specific condition type for alicense
Column Comment.5: CONDITION DESCRIPTION: textual description of the condition applied to thelicense.
Column Comment.6: LICENSE CONDITION: A list of valid condition types that can be placed on a license.These conditions may require activities, payments, reports, time deadlines etc.Management of these conditions may be undertaken through the OBLIGATION orPROJECT Modules as appropriate to your business.
Column Comment.7: CONDITION VALUE: a numeric value associated with the condition, such as a rateor an amount.
Column Comment.10: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: the unique indicator for the businessassociate who is the contact for this condition.
Column Comment.11: CURRENCY CONVERSION: The conversion factor applied to calculate the originalcurrency from the stored currency value.
Column Comment.12: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.13: DESCRIPTION: A short narrative description of the condition.
Column Comment.14: DUE CONDITION: The state that must be achieved for the condition to becomeeffective. For example, a report may be due 60 days after operations commence (orcease).
Column Comment.15: DUE DATE: The date that this condition must be fulfilled by.
Column Comment.16: DUE FREQUENCY: the frequency with which this condition must be met, such as anannual review. Where conditions are cycling in this way, please use the project (forwork flow) or obligations ( for payments) module to track completions.
Column Comment.17: DUE TERM: the period within which this condition must be satisfied, usually followingcompletion of operations.
Column Comment.18: DUE TERM UNIT OF MEASURE: the unit of measure for the due term, usually days,weeks, months.
Column Comment.19: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.20: EXEMPT INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that the holder of the license is exemptfrom this condition.
Column Comment.21: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.22: FULFILLED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: unique identifier for the business associatewho fulfilled this condition.
Column Comment.23: FULFILLED DATE: The date that this condition was fulfilled.
Column Comment.24: FULFILLED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this condition has been fulfilled.
Column Comment.25: GRANTED BY BUSINESS ASSOICATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thebusiness associate who grants this type of license.
Column Comment.26: LICENSE TYPE: The type of license that has been granted, such as an activitylicenes to produce, flare etc. In some jurisdicitons a single license may be granted tocover all operations, in others seperate licenses are granted based on the type ofoperation.
Column Comment.27: MINIMUM VALUE: The minimum value associated with the condition, such as theremust be at least 6 but not more than 10 staff on site at all times.
Column Comment.30: MINIMUM VALUE: The minimum value associated with the condition, such as theremust be at least 6 but not more than 10 staff on site at all times.
Column Comment.33: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.34: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.35: RESTRICTION IDENTIFER: Unique identifier for a restriction.
Column Comment.36: RESTRICTION VERSION: The version number of the restriction. In some areas,changes to the detailed requirements of a restriction result in versioning.
Column Comment.37: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.38: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.39: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.40: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.41: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.42: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.43: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.44: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
